title: Mom wows with her homemade Star Wars costumes
text:

Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Mom wows with her homemade Star Wars costumes Blair Shiff, KUSA 10:09 a.m. MDT October 23, 2015 Corrine Kurtz's amazing Star wars costumes for her twins (Photo: Corrine Kurtz) 23 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
KUSA - One Commerce City mom made some costumes for her 5-year-old twins that are out of this world. 
Corrine Kurtz made C-3P0 and an R2-D2 costumes and posted a video of them showing the costumes off on social media. 
Check out the video that's taking social media by storm: http://on.fb.me/1XozrRY. 
She said she used her old iPhone and loaded sound effects from C-3PO and R2-D2 onto it. Then, she and her husband connected the old iPhone to her husband's FitBit, where he controls all of the sounds. Kurtz said there are 15 sound effects loaded onto the old iPhone. 
"It took me three weeks to make them," Kurtz said. "Working on them several hours a day, and into the wee hours of the night." 
Kurtz makes her twins' costumes every year. 
"They request them, and I bring them to life," Kurtz said. 
These aren't her first impressive costumes for her twins, either. 
Corrine Kurtz made these costumes for her twins in 2012 (Photo: Corrine Kurtz) 
Minion costumes for Corrine Kurtz's twins in 2013. She jokingly called them "twinions" (Photo: Corrine Kurtz) 
Corrine Kurtz's costumes she made for her twins in 2014 (Photo: Corrine Kurtz) 
If you made an amazing costume for your kiddos, email us a picture or video at yourtake@9news.com.
